result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Rheinschmidt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony J Rheinschmidt in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Anthony J Rheinschmidt.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant in compliance. Case adjourned for review hearing by Zoom, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 9.23.22
Received and Filed. Notice of Completion
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Anthony J Rheinschmidt in court with attorney Jason A Findling, via zoom.  Annie Louk appeared on behalf of Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information. Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of rights and Addendum
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Anthony J Rheinschmidt not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State.  Defense further advises that the defendant has completed a tad evaluation. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony J Rheinschmidt in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Anthony J Rheinschmidt in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony J Rheinschmidt
Current: 2845 N Booth Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2022)
Prior: 1934 North Oakland Avenue #3, Milwaukee, WI 53202
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Anthony Rheinschmidt in court with attorney Ruby de Leon.  Defendant Anthony Rheinschmidt in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
